tn.text: Jeremiah speaks to Yahweh.
"they do not love or respect you"
Jeremiah continues speaking to Yahweh.

tn.ref: Take them away like sheep to the slaughter
tn.text: "Prepare to punish those wicked people"

tn.ref: How long will the land go on drying up ... because of the wickedness of its inhabitants?
tn.text: "The draught cause by the wickedness of the people has lasted too long." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Beasts and bird have been taken away
tn.text: The wild animals and birds have died from the draught.
"dry up"

tn.ref: God does not know what will happen to us.
tn.text: "God does not see the sins we do."

tn.ref: how can you compete against horses? ... how will you do in the thickets along the Jordan?
tn.text: These two questions are intended to make statements. AT: "you will never compete well against horses ... you will fail in the thickets along the Jordan." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: If you fall down in the safe countryside
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this passage in Hebrew as "If you feel secure in the safe countryside."
This refers to the open countryside, where it is easy to travel quickly, in contrast to the overgrown thickets along the Jordan River, where it is difficult to move.
many bushes or small trees growing close together

tn.ref: I have abandoned my house; I have forsaken my inheritance. I have given my own beloved people into the hands of her enemies.
tn.text: These three sentences have similar meanings. The first and second one strengthens the thought in the third. (See" Parallelism) AT: "I have allowed my people's enemies to conquer them."
a type of dog from Asia and Africa that eats the flesh of dead animals
birds that attack and eat animals
"they have crushed under their foot" or "they have destroyed"
"the ground I planted"
The word "her" refers to the Promised Land (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
The word "she" refers to the Promised Land
"cares" or "pays any attention" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"not covered" or "empty"
Yahweh is using these armies to punish his people (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: from one end of the land to the other
tn.text: This refers to all of the Promised Land (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"My people have"
a large plant that is covered in sharp points
"worn out" or "tired"
attack and capture
AT: "gave my people Israel as an inheritance"
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:09|1:10]].

tn.ref: pull up the house of Judah from among them
tn.text: allow the people of Judah to leave their enemies' lands and return to Judah
or "uproot"
AT: "I make those nations leave their lands and move to different places"
God's word about Judah's neighbors.

tn.ref: It will come about that if ... Baal, then they
tn.text: "This is what will happen ... Baal: they" or "If ... Baal, then this is what will happen: they"
middle

tn.ref: they will be built up in the midst of my people
tn.text: "I will make them wealthy and they will live among my people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I will uproot that nation. It will certainly be uprooted and destroyed
tn.text: "I will certainly and completely exile and destroy that nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].
